body.description: First Aid Only Triple Antibiotic Ointment packets help prevent infection and treat all kinds of minor cuts, burns, and abrasions. Our triple antibiotic packets provide first-aid antibiotic properties and promote fast healing.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: First Aid Refills Keeping your first aid kit or cabinet fully stocked is very important. First Aid Only offers a full selection of refill items to meet all your first aid needs. The individual boxes are perfectly sized for any application and can be used in both a first aid kit or as a stand-alone refill.

About Unitized Refill Boxes Feature 1: ANSI Color Guide Packaging Consistent color-coded packaging matches ANSI recommendations for easy identification when the user needs to find a first aid supply to treat an injury or know what to reorder for their kit. Feature 2: Organization Each unitized box is shrink-wrapped to keep product contained during shipping. Feature 3: Simplification Unit boxes simplify finding what you need in an emergency, as well as when you need to restock. Feature 4: Flexibility Missing a refill box in your First Aid Kit or Cabinet? The First Aid Only unitized refill boxes come in a variety of sizes to help you select the refill you need when replenishing your cabinet. The interchangeable refill boxes allow you to customize your kit or cabinet to meet the needs for a wide range of industries.

reviews.reviewerName: Buys Stuff I Don't NeedBuys Stuff I Don't Need
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for First Aid kits
reviews.reviewText: These little packets (25 ct box) are great for first aid kits. I was using a .5oz tube of Neosporin but you could contaminate the larger tube after the first use. That’s not going to happen with individual packets.The packets are .5g - .5oz tube is 14.2g, 25 ct box of these is 12.5gReceived Sept. 2022, expires March 2025Made in IndiaEach 25ct box was sealed in plasticSame 3 listed ingredients as original NeosporinThe narrow packet in the picture is the typical triple antibiotic packet you find in workplace first aid boxes which are .7g. These triple antibiotic packets are .5g and should be sufficient for most small scrapes, cuts or burns. Ointment removed from packet and placed next to a penny in the picture. I removed every last drop, you will most likely not get this much out under normal circumstances. The ointment was close to the same height and width as a penny. You might have a difficult time tearing open the packet if you have blood or sweat on your fingers. The packets seem like they would hold up well, they are not thin and easily opened by normal handling or compressing the packets. They need to be forcefully torn open.I would recommend these and will buy again when more are needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful addition to the kids Survival Kits!
reviews.reviewText: What Girl Scout survival tin would be complete without some triple antibiotic ointment? Or, what Boy Scout survival kit, vehicle safety kit or bug out bag would be complete without them?!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for work
reviews.reviewText: I am making my own first aid kit for work. This is perfect for my needs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I made little in case of emergency kits for my wedding guests and these were a perfect addition!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for multiple locations
reviews.reviewText: These are just the right size to have on hand for boo-boos. It's not practical to have a tube of ointment in multiple locations so this solves the problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Individual use triple-antibiotic packets
reviews.reviewText: These are great for including in first aid kits or a purse, or even for home use instead of a larger tube. Each 0.5 g. packet has more than enough for an application, and the expiration date is very good at 08/25 (ordered in 10/20). Great value, a couple of dozen packets for ~$5. These should last us quite awhile but I would not hesitate to order them again.The active ingredients listed are three antibiotics so it should work for the intended purpose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars small 0.5g packets for first aid kits
reviews.reviewText: Just FYI these are 0.5g and not 0.9 as advertised. They are very small packets measuring 2 1/2in x 1 3/8in, but they are great for first aid kits. There’s probably enough in there for a very small cut. You’d have to use multiple packets for a bigger wound, but these are perfect for traveling and on-the-go bags in case you need ointment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars First aid- antibiotic wipes
